unnormalised: The day my grandfather, Mr. Sharma, clutched his chest and gasped for air, time seemed to stop. He was a robust man, always pottering around his garden in Delhi, tending to his prize-winning roses. We rushed him to the nearest hospital, a small clinic in our locality. The doctor there, a young Dr. Kumar, immediately suspected a heart issue and advised us to go to Escorts Heart Institute.
normalised: The day my grandfather, Mister Sharma, clutched his chest and gasped for air, time seemed to stop. He was a robust man, always pottering around his garden in Delhi, tending to his prize-winning roses. We rushed him to the nearest hospital, a small clinic in our locality. The doctor there, a young Doctor Kumar, immediately suspected a heart issue and advised us to go to Escorts Heart Institute.

unnormalised: At Escorts, the specialists ran a series of tests. An ECG showed abnormalities, and the cardiologist, Dr. Verma, explained that Mr. Sharma had suffered a minor heart attack. "We need to perform an Angiography," she said, "to assess the extent of the blockage." The procedure was scheduled for 16/07/2024. I remember the anxiety swirling around the waiting room, the constant checking of my watch.
normalised: At Escorts, the specialists ran a series of tests. An E-C-G showed abnormalities, and the cardiologist, Doctor Verma, explained that Mister Sharma had suffered a minor heart attack. "We need to perform an Angiography," she said, "to assess the extent of the blockage." The procedure was scheduled for sixteenth July two thousand and twenty four. I remember the anxiety swirling around the waiting room, the constant checking of my watch.

unnormalised: The Angiography revealed a significant blockage in one of his coronary arteries. Dr. Verma recommended an Angioplasty with stent placement. She patiently explained that a stent, a tiny mesh tube, would be inserted to keep the artery open. The cost, approximately Rs. 2,50,000, was a concern, but the family pooled our resources. We were told the success rate was high, about 95%.

unnormalised: The Angioplasty was performed on 20/07/2024. The relief when Dr. Verma emerged from the operation theatre, smiling, was immense. "The procedure went well," she announced. Mr. Sharma would need medication - Aspirin 75mg daily, and another drug called Clopidogrel - and lifestyle changes, like a low-fat diet and regular walks, starting with just 15 minutes a day.

Mister Sharma would need medication - Aspirin seventy five milligram daily, and another drug called Clopidogrel - and lifestyle changes, like a low-fat diet and regular walks, starting with just fifteen minutes a day.

unnormalised: Looking back, the experience was a harsh reminder of life's fragility. My grandfather is now back in his garden, albeit at a slower pace. The incident highlighted the importance of timely intervention and the dedication of the medical professionals at Escorts Heart Institute. Regular check-ups with Dr. Kumar and adherence to medication are now a part of his routine. We are grateful for the second chance.
